comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message that invites users to sign up with their Apple account. It appears in UI elements related to provider authentication, such as buttons or dialogs. Translators should provide a clear and concise version of this phrase for users in different languages.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "تسجيل دخول بواسطة Apple" translates to "Sign in with Apple", not "Sign up with Apple".  'تسجيل دخول' means 'sign in' while 'تسجيل' implies 'sign up'.

The translation "Влезте чрез Apple" translates to "Log in with Apple". The original English phrase "Sign up with Apple" indicates a registration process, not a login. "Влезте" implies an existing account.

The translation 'Rekisteröidy Applella' is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Apple." It literally translates to 'Register with Apple'.  A better phrasing would be something like 'Luo tili Applella' (Create an account with Apple) or 'Kirjaudu sisään Applella' (Sign in with Apple), depending on the intended user flow.  'Rekisteröidy' often implies a more formal registration process.

While technically correct, the Armenian translation 'Գրանցվեք Apple-ով' is a bit literal and doesn't flow naturally. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Մուտքագրվեք Apple-ի միջոցով' or 'Ստեղծեք հաշիվ Apple-ի միջոցով'.
The Lao translation "ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍ Apple" literally translates to "Log in with Apple." The English phrase "Sign up with Apple" implies registration, not login.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເຂົ້າສູ່ການລົງທະບຽນດ້ວຍ Apple

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation contains a spelling error. 'ssię' should be 'się'.
The translation 'Inscreva-se na Apple' is a literal translation and doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'Sign up with Apple' in a natural Portuguese way. It sounds awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural Portuguese phrasing like 'Criar conta com a Apple' or 'Registar-se com a Apple' depending on the regional dialect. 'Continuar com a Apple' could also be suitable depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Cadastre-se com Apple" is a very literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Brazilian Portuguese. A more common and idiomatic phrase would be 'Inscreva-se com Apple' or 'Criar conta com Apple'. "Cadastre-se" often implies a more complex or detailed registration process.

The translation 'Conectare prin Apple' while understandable, doesn't perfectly capture the meaning of 'Sign up with Apple'. 'Conectare' implies a connection, but 'Sign up' implies creating an account. A more accurate translation would use a verb signifying registration or account creation.

The translation 'ඇපල් සමඟ ලියාපදිංචිය' is a literal translation of 'with Apple' and while understandable, it's not the most natural way to say 'Sign up with Apple' in Sinhala.  A more idiomatic translation would be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ඇපල් භාවිතා කොට ලියාපදිංචිය' (Apple udā gaha lakudīḍiñciya) or 'ඇපල් ඔස්සේ ලියාපදිංචිය' (Apple ossae lakudīḍiñciya).  Both options flow better and are more commonly used.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Vpiši se z Apple" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Apple." While understandable, "Prijavi se z Apple" would be more common and idiomatic in Slovenian.

The translation "Региструј се путем Apple-а" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Apple." It literally translates to 'Register via Apple.' A more common and idiomatic translation would be something like 'Пријави се са Apple-ом' or 'Креирај налог са Apple-ом'.

While understandable, "Registruj se putem Apple-a" is a somewhat literal translation and not the most natural phrasing in Serbian. A more idiomatic translation would be something like "Prijavi se sa Apple-om" or "Kreiraj nalog sa Apple-om".
While "用 Apple 帐号注册" is understandable, it's a bit literal and doesn't flow naturally in Chinese. A more idiomatic translation would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 使用 Apple ID 注册 (Shǐyòng Apple ID zhùcè)
